title: Cuda 9.2 pip install having trouble finding the right cuda
body_html:
Issue description

As the binaries for 0.4.1 just added support for 9.2, I decided to upgrade to cuda 9.2 and upgrade pytorch. I purged my cuda 9.0 install and made sure locate cuda-9-0 gave no results and also made sure that the LD_LIBRARY_PATH, PATH, and CUDA_HOME all don't reference cuda-9-0 anymore. nvcc -V also shows 9.2 as the version present. When I try importing torch, I get this error

ImportError: libcurand.so.9.0: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory

indicating it's still looking for cuda 9.0 for some reason. Is there anything else besides those 3 environment variables that I'd need to fix?

  • PyTorch or Caffe2: Pytorch
  • How you installed PyTorch (conda, pip, source): pip
  • OS: Ubuntu 16.04
  • PyTorch version: 0.4.1
  • Python version: 3.5 (although I tried with 3.6 and that failed too)
  • CUDA/cuDNN version: 9.2/7.1.4
  • GPU models and configuration: 1080 ti * 4
